title: Happy 750th birthday, Westminster Abbey – I only wish I’d appreciated it more as a teenager
text:
Seven hundred and fifty years ago today, on October 13, 1269, Britain’s greatest building was consecrated.

Thanks to Henry III’s patronage, London’s medieval skyline was punctured by a bristling thicket of flying buttresses and crocketed spires – Westminster Abbey. And now the building’s 750th anniversary is being celebrated in a book edited by distinguished historian, David Cannadine.

It was in Westminster Abbey – and its ancient, monastic quarters - that I spent my teenage years at Westminster School. Three times a week, I went to services in the finest church in the country. Well, that is, when I wasn’t bunking off. I now adore old buildings – and worship Westminster Abbey – but, as a teenager,...
description: Seven hundred and fifty years ago today, on October 13, 1269, Britain’s greatest building was consecrated.
